Articles.Content: Thank you for making this! Reminds me of BobCat's Kliper, only more kerbal-y. Still holding out hope for someone to make a proper Dreamchaser mod, but this is awesome.

I'm quickly falling in love with this little part! Thank you! There aren't any good high-capicity crew pods out there. The Taurus and Frejya mods are great, but they are too big for my taste, and I don't care for all the flags and dragons and writing on the LazTek SpaceX pods. But now we have this beautiful little shuttle to get people into orbit!
Another update coming soon: IVA will be implemented in a couple of days after I figure out some props problems.

Thank you for making this! Reminds me of BobCat's Kliper, only more kerbal-y. Still holding out hope for someone to make a proper Dreamchaser mod, but this is awesome.

This is actually a really good Kerbal Dream Chaser. I too am waiting for an actual Dream Chaser mod but this one is pretty close. Its also basically in the same stages of development as this mod but there is a release version you can play with and it fly's wonderfully.\

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/71095-Pteron-Micro-Shuttle-and-rescue-vehicle

This is actually a really good Kerbal Dream Chaser. I too am waiting for an actual Dream Chaser mod but this one is pretty close. Its also basically in the same stages of development as this mod but there is a release version you can play with and it fly's wonderfully.\

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/71095-Pteron-Micro-Shuttle-and-rescue-vehicle

Well, Aeria needs some test pilots, who can help me understand what is wrong with aerodynamics. And I put some kind of read-me or guidelines, I guess it will help.

Edited September 5, 2014 by Niemand303
Some WIP IVA screens
Testing some aerodynamics tweaks
Please tell me you are going to do your own landing gear.
IVAs look good!

Please tell me you are going to do your own landing gear.

Yeah, I'll do them. After that the project will be in an "on hold" mode (as Pteron does actually the same thing) and I think I will make some mini-ISS modules to fit with other Tantares parts and a LES and fairings for Tantares and possibly some mini-launchers. But it's still quite a distant future until I figure out the gears.

And the 0.17 release!

This version includes several aerodynamic bug fixes and the RPM IVA! Enjoy!

Currently, IVA has no windows, but they will come Soon! TM

As always, you can find them on KerbalStuff and Curse.
any pictures of the IVA?

any pictures of the IVA?

Here you are, take off and orbital insertion in full IVA

What landing gear are most people using? Which looks best?? Has anyone successfully made any skids in ksp yet??

This is a fun, great little craft. Thanks for making it and keep it going.

Good work.
Good work,but you must set center of mass in the shuttle

Good work,but you must set center of mass in the shuttle

Where should I put it? I've adjusted it to make the shuttle more stable in the atmosphere.

What landing gear are most people using? Which looks best?? Has anyone successfully made any skids in ksp yet??

This is a fun, great little craft. Thanks for making it and keep it going.

Good work.

Thanks for the feedback! About the skids, if I remember correctly, Pteron has landing skids. I think I will also put little skids on the bottom. Until then I use stock gears.

Thanks for the feedback! About the skids, if I remember correctly, Pteron has landing skids. I think I will also put little skids on the bottom. Until then I use stock gears.

Pteron now has built in landing gear bays and wheels. I don't remember seeing anything with skids.. Would be a nice novelty to have..... Long landings in the arctic and antarctic.

Thanks for the feedback! About the skids, if I remember correctly, Pteron has landing skids. I think I will also put little skids on the bottom. Until then I use stock gears.

I don't think I'll need landing gear. Using my "Trainer" craft (shuttle strapped to plane). I have managed to perform landings in the water AND on land without losing a single part on the shuttle itself.
That would be very bad for the heat shield

That would be very bad for the heat shield

Well the kerbals probably repair it. Plus the shuttle itself survives, so in career mode it would be better for the budget to not have landing gear as it is just a luxury for the shuttle.
Landing gear would still be nice since I never play career

That would be very bad for the heat shield

The VMK variant of Kliper could make even more serious damage to the heat shield as it was intended to land on the parachute.

Landing gear would still be nice since I never play career

I will make them (and possibly skids) when I will have a bit more time to understand how the animations work and should landing gears work in KSP.
That's find I don't mind when their made
